Autodocumentation of the Conditionals module¶

Models¶

class concord.conditionals.models.ApprovalCondition(id, owner_content_type, owner_object_id, foundational_permission_enabled, governing_permission_enabled, action, approved, self_approval_allowed)¶
exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
classmethod get_configurable_fields()¶

All conditions must supply their own version of the get_configurable_fields method, which should return a dict with field names as keys and field objects (ie BooleanField) as values.

class concord.conditionals.models.ConditionTemplate(*args, **kwargs)¶

condition_type - one of the concrete ConditionModel types specified in this file condition_data - configures a condition that isn’t simply using defaults, for instance

making the voting period longer or setting self-approval to True

permission_data - this data is used to create a permissions resource for the condition,

otherwise the default permission is used

conditioned_object - pk of the thing the condition is set on conditioning_choices - currently only ‘permission’ or (less likely) ‘community_governor’,

‘community_owner’

exception DoesNotExist¶
exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶
class concord.conditionals.models.VoteCondition(id, owner_content_type, owner_object_id, foundational_permission_enabled, governing_permission_enabled, action, yeas, nays, allow_abstain, abstains, require_majority, publicize_votes, voted, voting_starts, voting_period)¶
exception DoesNotExist¶

classmethod get_configurable_fields()¶

All conditions must supply their own version of the get_configurable_fields method, which should return a dict with field names as keys and field objects (ie BooleanField) as values.

concord.conditionals.models.conditionModel¶

alias of concord.conditionals.models.VoteCondition

State Changes¶

Client¶

class concord.conditionals.client.ApprovalConditionClient(actor=None, target=None, system=False)¶

The target of the ApprovalConditionClient must always be an ApprovalCondition instance.

class concord.conditionals.client.BaseConditionalClient(actor=None, target=None, system=False)¶

The BaseConditionClient should not be called directly, but contains methods that are common to both PermissionConditionalClient and CommunityConditionalClient.

Most of the methods on the BaseConditional are client-less, but there are a couple that do require targets. For those, either the target of PermissionConditionalClient (Permission) or CommunityConditionalClient (Community) are allowed.

class concord.conditionals.client.CommunityConditionalClient(actor=None, target=None, system=False)¶

Target is always a Community. Specifically, a conditional may be set on the Governors role, the Owners role, or both, to place limits on their decision-making authority.

instantiate_condition(condition_template)¶

Helper method, does not save condition instance.

class concord.conditionals.client.PermissionConditionalClient(actor=None, target=None, system=False)¶

Target is always a Permission.

class concord.conditionals.client.VoteConditionClient(actor=None, target=None, system=False)¶

The target of the VoteConditionClient must always be a VoteCondition instance.
